doc.field: Series XXIII: Pride and Progress / The Right Stuff
Series XXIII: Pride and Progress / The Right Stuff
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 15 [2]--The Right Stuff, Episode No. 191[Air Date: 4/8/1986]
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 15 [2]--The Right Stuff, Episode No. 191[Air Date: 4/8/1986]
3. Atlanta, city council amends constitution to protect against discrimination based on sexual orientation
4. Moral majority leader Jerry Falwell responds to phone harassment by cancelling phone service
5. New York City, fight against homophobic rhetoric of religious leaders
COMMERCIAL: Casio Pocket TV6. Davis, California city council amends constitution to protect against discrimination based on sexual orientation
7. San Francisco, USPS apologizes for opening and returning mail of the Harvey Milk Lesbian and Gay Democratic Club
8. Chicago, gay father allowed to visit children without taking a court-mandated AIDs test
COMMERCIAL: "New York Native" with Quentin Crisp
9. NYC, Coverage of Ed Koch signing the Gay Rights Bill into law
11. Gay Health Report: mental health in light of HTLV-III Antibody testing for AIDS
12. 1982 survey finds one-fourth of doctors are homophobic
13. National Association of Insurance Commissioners appoints two gay rights activists to a task force for policy-making
15. Outreach: Conversations with GMHC: Joey Leonte discusses GMHC-produced erotic comic books to promote safer sex
1. Summer reading recommendations from Different Light Bookstore
2. Sybil Bruncheon continues interview of musical guest Pink Limo
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 15 [2]--The Right Stuff, Episode No. 191[Air Date: 4/8/1986]: April 1986
